Authors:
Ivan Pavlov, Kirill Bobrov, Anastasiya Sumacheva, Alexey
Masharsky, Dmitrii Polev, Elena Gjurishkina, Anna Kulminskaya
Title:
Reclassification of the strain Geotrichum candidum Link 3C as
Scytalidium candidum comb nov. 3C based on phylogenetic and
morphological analysis
Keywords:
Re-classification, Geotrichum, Scytalidium, multiple gene
sequencing
Abstract:
In the 1970s, the strain Geotrichum candidum Link 3C was
isolated from rotting wood and since then has been extensively studied
as a source of cellulose and xylan-degrading enzymes. The original
identification of the strain was based only on morphological characters
of the fungal mycelium in culture. Recent comparison of internal
transcribed spacerÂ (ITS) fragments derived from the draft genome
published in 2015 did not reveal its similarity to G. candidum species.
Given the value of the strain Geotrichum candidum Link 3C in
lignocellulosic biomass degradation, we performed morphological and
molecular studies to find the appropriate taxonomic placement for this
fungal strain within the Ascomycota phylum. ITS, 18S rDNA, 28S rDNA
sequences and RPB2 encoding genes were used to construct phylogenetic
trees with Maximum likelihood and Bayesian inference methods. Based on
multiple gene sequencing, we conclude that fungal strain designated as
Geotrichum candidum Link 3C should be placed into the genus Scytalidium
and is redescribed herein as Scytalidium candidum 3C comb. nov.
